intro: Santiria pedicellata, commonly known as the yellow antelope's horn, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces yellowish-white flowers that are often visited by insects, facilitating pollination. Its fruit is a capsule that releases seeds when mature, contributing to its dispersal. Santiria pedicellata is often found in open woodlands and grasslands, thriving in well-drained soils.
